author: torran_g
content:
Now that the date for the Shapella Mainnet upgrade is official, the team here at Metrika is excited to roll out 2 dashboards to help everyone prepare for the upgrade.

Our new Network Upgrades dashboard tracks client releases, network readiness, and the impact an upgrade is having on network performance. Access it here: https://app.metrika.co/ethereum/dashboard/network-upgrade

We've added new charts to our Withdrawals dashboard to help you track the impact withdrawals are having on network dynamics in real-time. Access it here: https://app.metrika.co/ethereum/dashboard/withdrawals-overview

Feel free to send us your feedback and suggestions!

author: pietjepuk
content: From looking at the gossipsub v1.1 spec and libp2p-rust, it seems that _new_ messages are flood published by default to _all_ connected peers (meeting a certain minimum peer score).

author: pietjepuk
content: And on the topic of CLI params, at least Lighthouse has a parameter to change that with `--network-load` (hidden by default). If the above is true, it will only affect gossiping through the mesh network afaict (and not the flood publishing of a new message originating from your node).
